text: today we're gonna booze it up here at
everyday food I'm gonna make a fresh
strawberry daiquiri and because I can't
leave well enough alone I'm gonna make a
lime sugar to put on the rim of the
glass just for you know that little
extra added something so to start off
with I'm making the lime sugar you'll
need a tablespoon of lime zest it's
probably 2 limes depends alright that
seems like about a tablespoon I guess I
could measure if I wanted to this is two
tablespoons of sugar that's in this
little food processor and grind
everything together make it this very
fragrant limey sugar which is really
nice just spread that on a little plate
that way you can dip the rims of the
glass in there when you're ready to
serve the drinks now for the drink you
need a quarter cup of lime juice that
was 1 and 1/2 limes in case you were
wondering now I just need one little
wedge to wet the ribs of the glass for
dipping in the sugar so I'll do that now
then this is 4 cups of strawberries I've
removed the hull they can go directly
into your blender the lime juice into
the blender 2/3 of a cup of white rum 2
cups of ice I don't like my strawberry
daiquiris to be that like slushy
consistency so this does have ice in it
but it's not super duper thick you can
actually drink it like a drink instead
of spooning it like an ice-cream and
there's a little bit of sugar in here
you can use 2 to 4 tablespoons I'm using
3 I don't like them to be too sweet
strawberries are already really sweet
too so make it taste it and if you want
to add the additional sugar go ahead
and then for the glasses I'm going to
run the lime wedge around the edge just
to get it damp and then the sugar goes
on the rim you just just like that dip
the whole thing right in and it comes
out really pretty nice maybe you want to
make a version where you leave the rum
out for the kids so that everybody can
enjoy this fresh and delicious cake on a
strawberry daiquiri enjoy
you
